Description: Burnt sard gem engraved with an assembly of gods: at the top is Zeus seated with sceptre and eagle; below him are Aphrodite and Eros (with bow) in mid-air. Around the stone are: Athena with helmet, spear and shield; four female deities and an altar (perhaps one is Hestia); Ares seated; Hades (?) seated before two columns and a flight of steps; Poseidon seated before columns; Demeter and Persephone with sheaves of corn; Hermes with caduceus; Apollo seated with a lyre; and an uncertain figure, perhaps Hephaistos, addressing Zeus. In the centre is a Greek inscription.
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (1241)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
